chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent Lee Voelker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Order restitution be paid to the Crime Victim Compensation Program either Minnesota or Wisconsin as it relates to this case in an amount TBD.  Order up to 25% held by the Department of Corrections be applied towards any restitution.
AMENDED 10-02-2017:  Restitution determined in the amount of $396.82 to be paid to:  MN Crime Victims Reparations Board.  See Order.
Pay court costs/surcharges as directed by Probation & Parole.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Partial Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held 02-01-2016.

Defendant Brent Lee Voelker in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters requests to adjourn.  Court denies requst for continuance. Victim Witness Coordinator read victims statements.  State recommends 5 yrs IC, 5 yrs ES with conditions of ES as stated in PSI.  Atty Waters closing argument.  Court sentences defendant to 13 yrs. in WI State Prison system, 8 yrs IC, 5 yrs ES with conditions of ES to include comply with sex offender registry, provide a DNA sample; pay the costs of case; follow sex offender supervision rules, no contact with H.F. or her immediate family; no contact with children under the age of 18  except as permitted by P&P.  Find defendant not eligible for Substance Abuse Program, Aged out of Challenge Incarceration Program.  Advised of appeal rights.
Psychosexual Evaluation filed by Defense counsel.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brent Lee Voelker in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties reached an agreement.  Court advises defendant of elements/max. penalties; other consequences of serious child sex offense and felony prohibitions.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Court finds defendant's waiver of constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily; find factual foundation exists and finds defendant guilty.  Order PSI.  Any conditions of bond previously set are cont'd.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing at 11-30-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant Brent Lee Voelker in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Chief Jesse Van Alstine - Sworn & Examined.  Exhibits 1, 2, 3 O&R.  View of Exhibit 1 from 3:19 to 4:40.  Arguments by counsel.  Court denies motion to suppress.
Motion hearing at 10-06-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Brent Lee Voelker in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes State informs the information will be the same information as on Complaint.  Using the complaint, court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties, felony prohibitions, etc.; advises defendant of constitutional rights.  Note he stands mute, enter a NGP on his behalf.  Atty Waters informs court he already scheduled a MH, motion to suppress, already filed.  Both counsel to file any motions within 30 days.  Any conditions of bond previously set are continued.

Defendant Brent Lee Voelker in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to waive P.H.  Off record to complete WOPH form.  Back on record.  Court receives WOPH form, explains WOPH, show WPH, bind over for trial.  State informs court Information would be same as complaint.  Atty Waters accepts that and stands mute.
J.V. is required to appear on 10/06/2015 at 3:00 pm
Motion hearing at 10-06-2015 03:00 pm
Motion to Suppress Statements and Brief in Support of Motion.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
No violations of conditions of bond in Winona County, MN case; 
No contact with any persons under the age of 18.

Defendant Brent Lee Volker in court with Attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advised of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $2500 cash bond.  Atty Waters informs the court defendant under $4500 cash bond in Winona County, MN which he posted.  Court sets bond @ $4500 can be posted by signature with conditions:  no violations of conditions of bond in Winona County, MN case; no contact with any persons under the age of 18.  Time limits waived for P.H.  Referred to scheduling clerk for new date outside of intake.
Atty Patrick Waters appt'd.
